abort-api.summary: Allows DOM requests (such as fetch requests) to be aborted if desired.
abort-api.title: Abort API

asmjs.summary: A Strict & highly optimizable subset of JavaScript that can be used as a low-level compile target.
asmjs.title: asm.js

async-function.summary: Async functions make it possible to treat functions returning Promise objects as if they were synchronous.
async-function.title: Async functions

background-sync.summary: Provides one-off and periodic synchronization for Service Workers with an onsync event.
background-sync.title: Background Sync API

canvas-media-capture.summary: Allows real-time video capture of the surface of the canvas.
canvas-media-capture.title: Canvas Media Capture

credential-management.summary: This API lets a website request credentials from a user agent and helps it store these credentials for future use.
credential-management.title: Credential Management API

css-backdrop-filter.summary: Applies filter effects to elements below the target element.
css-backdrop-filter.title: CSS backdrop-filter (subset of Filter FX L2)

css-box-alignment-block.summary: Extends the use of CSS Box Alignment properties beyond CSS Grid and Flexbox layouts, to any block layout.
css-box-alignment-block.title: CSS Box Alignment (for block layout)

css-clip-path.summary: Defines a shape as a clipping region over an element. Only the parts of the element inside the clipping region are displayed.
css-clip-path.title: CSS clip-path

css-variables.summary: A way to define and use variables that can be used in place of any CSS property.
css-variables.title: CSS Custom Properties (CSS Variables)

css-display-flow-root.summary: Provides a native clearfix solution that doesn't rely on extra markup and CSS hacks.
css-display-flow-root.title: CSS display: flow-root

css-font-display.summary: Determines how a font face is displayed based on whether and when it is downloaded and ready to use.
css-font-display.title: CSS Font Rendering Controls (font-display)

css-font-variation-settings.summary: Provides low-level control over OpenType or TrueType font typographic features.
css-font-variation-settings.title: CSS Font Variation Settings

css-fragmentation.summary: Controls how blocks break between pages and columns.
css-fragmentation.title: CSS Fragmentation (break-* properties)

css-grid-layout.summary: A two-dimensional grid-based layout system, optimized for user interface design.
css-grid-layout.title: CSS Grid Layout

css-initial-letter.summary: A CSS property providing styling for dropped, raised, and sunken initial letters.
css-initial-letter.title: CSS initial-letter

css-motion-path.summary: Allow authors to animate graphical objects along an author-defined path.
css-motion-path.title: CSS Motion Path

css-multicol.summary: Allows content to be broken across multiple columns, like a book index or a newspaper layout.
css-multicol.title: CSS Multiple column Layout
css-multicol.firefox_footnote: column-span is not supported, nor fragmentation properties

css-overscroll-behavior.summary: Allows you to control the browser's scroll overflow behavior â€” what happens when the boundary of a scrolling area is reached.
css-overscroll-behavior.title: CSS overscroll-behavior

css-shapes.summary: Allows document content to be wrapped around non-rectangular shapes; it is a subset of the CSS Shapes Level 1 spec.
css-shapes.title: CSS shape-outside (Subset of CSS Shapes)

css-subgrids.summary: Allows a CSS grid nested inside another CSS grid to be connected to its containing grid; all browsers left this feature out of their initial grid implementation.
css-subgrids.title: CSS Subgrids

custom-elements.summary: Allows for the definition of custom HTML elements that are then associated with ES6 classes.
custom-elements.title: Custom Elements

device-orientation.summary: Provides access to device's physical orientation.
device-orientation.title: Device Orientation

fetch.summary: A low-level API for fetching network resources that is more powerful and flexible than XMLHttpRequest.
fetch.title: Fetch API

fullscreen.summary: Provides an easy way for web content to be presented using the user's entire screen.
fullscreen.title: Fullscreen API

gamepad.summary: Provides access and responses to signals from gamepads and other game controllers.
gamepad.title: Gamepad API

html-imports.summary: Allows HTML documents and fragments to be conveniently reused in other HTML documents.
html-imports.title: HTML Imports

html-templates.summary: Declared fragments of markup that are parsed as HTML, but implicitly inactive until instantiated later on at runtime.
html-templates.title: HTML Templates

htmlcanvaselement-toblob.summary: Creates a Blob object representing a file containing an image captured from a canvas.
htmlcanvaselement-toblob.title: HTMLCanvasElement.toBlob()

http2.summary: Next revision of the HTTP protocol for faster transport of web content.
http2.title: HTTP/2
http2.webkit_footnote: Depends on the networking stack of the system (https://lists.webkit.org/pipermail/webkit-help/2015-February/003884.html).

indexeddb.summary: An asynchronous client-side storage API offering fast access to large amounts of structured data.
indexeddb.title: Indexed DB

intersection-observer.summary: Asynchronously observes changes in the intersection of two elements; enables code to react to changes in the visibility of these elements.
intersection-observer.title: Intersection Observer API

javascript-modules.summary: Modules allow for easy modularization and encapsulation of JavaScript code across separate files.
javascript-modules.title: JavaScript Modules

link-rel-preload.summary: A hint for supporting browsers to prefetch specified resources without executing them, allowing developers to precisely control what resources are loaded and when. Used properly, this can lead to significant performance improvements.
link-rel-preload.title: Link Rel Preload

media-recorder.summary: Provides the ability to encode audio and video streams on the fly in the browser.
media-recorder.title: Media Recorder

mse.summary: Allows for the creation of media streams via JavaScript, which can be played using <audio> and <video> elements.
mse.title: Media Source Extensions

page-visibility.summary: Programmatically determines the visibility state of a page, and provides notification if the visibility state changes.
page-visibility.title: Page Visibility API

passive-event-listeners.summary: An API for registering event listeners that explicitly cannot prevent the default action of the event.
passive-event-listeners.title: Passive Event Listeners

web-payment-app.summary: Allows web applications to request permission from the end-user to handle requests for payments from the Payment Request API.
web-payment-app.title: Payment Handler API

payment-request.summary: Specifies a workflow enabling browsers to handle web-based payments in a consistent manner, facilitating interactions between users, retailers, and card networks.
payment-request.title: Payment Request API

performance-observer.summary: Observes performance measurement events and sends notifications of new performance entries as they are recorded in the browser performance timeline.
performance-observer.title: Performance Observer API

performance-navigation-timing.summary: Provides methods and properties to store and retrieve metrics regarding the browser's document navigation events.
performance-navigation-timing.title: PerformanceNavigationTiming

performance-server-timing.summary: Exposes server metrics that are sent with the response in the Server-Timing HTTP header.
performance-server-timing.title: PerformanceServerTiming

permissions.summary: Provides a consistent programmatic way to query the status of API permissions attributed to the current context.
permissions.title: Permissions API

permissions-request.summary: Requests permission to use a given API.
permissions-request.title: Permissions.request()

permissions-revoke.summary: Revokes the permission currently set on a given API.
permissions-revoke.title: Permissions.revoke()

pointer-events.summary: Handles hardware-agnostic pointer input from devices including mouse, pen, touchscreen, etc.
pointer-events.title: Pointer events

pointerlock.summary: Provides access to raw mouse movement, locks the target of mouse events to a single element, eliminates limits of how far mouse movement can go in a single direction, and removes the cursor from view.
pointerlock.title: Pointer Lock

promise.summary: The Promise object is used for deferred and asynchronous computations.
promise.title: Promises

push.summary: Allows messages to be pushed to the client from a server even when the site isn't focused or even open in the user agent.
push.title: Push API

request-idle-callback.summary: Requests a callback when the user agent is idle, allowing developers to schedule background computation tasks on the event loop that have a better chance of not interfering with other more time-critical operations.
request-idle-callback.title: requestIdleCallback (Background Tasks API)

screen-orientation.summary: Allows screen orientation to be programmatically set and locked, and provides events to signal orientation changes.
screen-orientation.title: Screen Orientation API

service-worker.summary: Event-driven scripts that can handle network requests and manage cached responses in the background.
service-worker.title: Service Worker
service-worker.firefox_footnote: Service workers are not available in Firefox ESR versions 45 and 52

shadow-dom.summary: Provides encapsulation for JavaScript, CSS, and templating inside Web Components. This refers to the modern standard Shadow DOM, not Chrome's original experimental version.
shadow-dom.title: Shadow DOM

shared-array-buffer.summary: Fine-grained sharing and borrowing of ArrayBuffers between workers.
shared-array-buffer.title: Shared Array Buffers

shared-worker.summary: A specific kind of worker that can be accessed from several browsing contexts (including windows, iframes, and other workers).
shared-worker.title: Shared Worker

slots.summary: Allows you to create placeholders inside HTML templates that can be filled with chosen content when a Web Component is instantiated.
slots.title: Slots

streams.summary: Allows streams of data to be represented and handled in JavaScript.
streams.title: Streams API

subresource-integrity.summary: Provides an integrity attribute allowing scripts and stylesheets to protect against unexpected modifications.
subresource-integrity.title: Subresource Integrity

vibration.summary: Provides access to vibration hardware, allowing physical feedback to the user by causing the device to shake.
vibration.title: Vibration API

web-animations.summary: Creates and manages animations run by the browser (detailed Firefox implementation status).
web-animations.title: Web Animations API

app-manifest.summary: A JSON-based manifest providing developers with a centralized place to put metadata associated with a web application.
app-manifest.title: Web Application Manifest

webaudio.summary: A high-level web API for processing and synthesizing audio in web applications.
webaudio.title: Web Audio API

web-authentication.summary: An extension of the Credential Management API that enables strong authentication with public key cryptography, enabling password-less authentication and secure second-factor authentication without SMS texts.
web-authentication.title: Web Authentication API

web-bluetooth.summary: An API for communicating with Bluetooth Low Energy devices as a GATT Client.
web-bluetooth.title: Web Bluetooth API

web-payment-request.summary: Allow web sites selling goods to use integrated payment methods.
web-payment-request.title: Web Payment Request API

webspeech-recognition.summary: Recognizes speech input in web applications.
webspeech-recognition.title: Web Speech Recognition

webspeech-synthesis.summary: Generates text-to-speech output in web applications.
webspeech-synthesis.title: Web Speech Synthesis

web-assembly.summary: A low-level, portable, size- and load-time-efficient binary code format designed to serve as a compilation target for the Web.
web-assembly.title: WebAssembly (WASM)

webgl-1.summary: An API closely conforming to OpenGL ES 2.0, for rendering 2D and 3D graphics in a <canvas> element.
webgl-1.title: WebGL 1.0

webgl-2.summary: An update to WebGL, based on OpenGL ES 3.0.
webgl-2.title: WebGL 2.0

webrtc.summary: Captures and streams audio, video, and arbitrary data between browsers without requiring an intermediary.
webrtc.title: WebRTC (Web Real-Time Communications)

websocket.summary: Allows for the creation and management of a WebSocket connection to a server, as well as sending and receiving data via the connection.
websocket.title: WebSocket API

webvr.summary: Provides support for exposing virtual reality displays â€” like the Oculus Rift or HTC Vive â€” to web apps, enabling developers to create interactive virtual reality scenes on the web platform.
webvr.title: WebVR API 1.1
